# Repository structure refactoring plan (2026-02-19 16:48Z)

_**User**_

Please help me make a plan to refactor the structure of this repository:

This project will soon be polyglot, including components in go, rust and zig. I would like to refactor the repository structure so it supports this. library code should be in lib/, and distinct libraries should have thier own build.zig file. e.g., what's in src/ currently should become core/z_plug. the vst/clap bindings and dsp utils should be seperated into their own libraries, named with the z_ prefix. the kissfft bindings should also be in thier own project/module. examples/ structure is fine, but these example plugins should become thier own zig projects with their own build.zig files. in build tools, we should expose helpers that configure plugin builds, such that plugins can import and use them to build plugins without having to reinvend the wheel. You should also remove the stub at src/main.zig, I will be developing a cli, but not from there. Remember that we use zig 0.15.2, and you need to use the version from the nix/direnv setup.

---

   // This is the default name used by packages depending on this one. For\\\\\\\\n    // example, when a user runs &#96;zig fetch --save &lt;url&gt;&#96;, this field is used\\\\\\\\n    // as the key in the &#96;dependencies&#96; table. Although the user can choose a\\\\\\\\n    // different name, most users will stick with this provided value.\\\\\\\\n    //\\\\\\\\n    // It is redundant to include \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"zig\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" in this name because it is already\\\\\\\\n    // within the Zig package namespace.\\\\\\\\n    .name = .z_plug,\\\\\\\\n    // This is a [Semantic Version](https://semver.org/).\\\\\\\\n    // In a future version of Zig it will be used for package deduplication.\\\\\\\\n    .version = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"0.0.0\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n    // Together with name, this represents a globally unique package\\\\\\\\n    // identifier. This field is generated by the Zig toolchain when the\\\\\\\\n    // package is first created, and then *never changes*. This allows\\\\\\\\n    // unambiguous detection of one package being an updated version of\\\\\\\\n    // another.\\\\\\\\n    //\\\\\\\\n    // When forking a Zig project, this id should be regenerated (delete the\\\\\\\\n    // field and run &#96;zig build&#96;) if the upstream project is still maintained.\\\\\\\\n    // Otherwise, the fork is *hostile*, attempting to take control over the\\\\\\\\n    // original project's identity. Thus it is recommended to leave the comment\\\\\\\\n    // on the following line intact, so that it shows up in code reviews that\\\\\\\\n    // modify the field.\\\\\\\\n    .fingerprint = 0xa543c8e2bd4ca5c, // Changing this has security and trust implications.\\\\\\\\n    // Tracks the earliest Zig version that the package considers to be a\\\\\\\\n    // supported use case.\\\\\\\\n    .minimum_zig_version = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"0.15.2\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n    // This field is optional.\\\\\\\\n    // Each dependency must either provide a &#96;url&#96; and &#96;hash&#96;, or a &#96;path&#96;.\\\\\\\\n    // &#96;zig build --fetch&#96; can be used to fetch all dependencies of a package, recursively.\\\\\\\\n    // Once all dependencies are fetched, &#96;zig build&#96; no longer requires\\\\\\\\n    // internet connectivity.\\\\\\\\n    .dependencies = .{\\\\\\\\n        // See &#96;zig fetch --save &lt;url&gt;&#96; for a command-line interface for adding dependencies.\\\\\\\\n        //.example = .{\\\\\\\\n        //    // When updating this field to a new URL, be sure to delete the corresponding\\\\\\\\n        //    // &#96;hash&#96;, otherwise you are communicating that you expect to find the old hash at\\\\\\\\n        //    // the new URL. If the contents of a URL change this will result in a hash mismatch\\\\\\\\n        //    // which will prevent zig from using it.\\\\\\\\n        //    .url = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"https://example.com/foo.tar.gz\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n        //\\\\\\\\n        //    // This is computed from the file contents of the directory of files that is\\\\\\\\n        //    // obtained after fetching &#96;url&#96; and applying the inclusion rules given by\\\\\\\\n        //    // &#96;paths&#96;.\\\\\\\\n        //    //\\\\\\\\n        //    // This field is the source of truth; packages do not come from a &#96;url&#96;; they\\\\\\\\n        //    // come from a &#96;hash&#96;. &#96;url&#96; is just one of many possible mirrors for how to\\\\\\\\n        //    // obtain a package matching this &#96;hash&#96;.\\\\\\\\n        //    //\\\\\\\\n        //    // Uses the [multihash](https://multiformats.io/multihash/) format.\\\\\\\\n        //    .hash = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"...\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n        //\\\\\\\\n        //    // When this is provided, the package is found in a directory relative to the\\\\\\\\n        //    // build root. In this case the package's hash is irrelevant and therefore not\\\\\\\\n        //    // computed. This field and &#96;url&#96; are mutually exclusive.\\\\\\\\n        //    .path = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"foo\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n        //\\\\\\\\n        //    // When this is set to &#96;true&#96;, a package is declared to be lazily\\\\\\\\n        //    // fetched. This makes the dependency only get fetched if it is\\\\\\\\n        //    // actually used.\\\\\\\\n        //    .lazy = false,\\\\\\\\n        //},\\\\\\\\n    },\\\\\\\\n    // Specifies the set of files and directories that are included in this package.\\\\\\\\n    // Only files and directories listed here are included in the &#96;hash&#96; that\\\\\\\\n    // is computed for this package. Only files listed here will remain on disk\\\\\\\\n    // when using the zig package manager. As a rule of thumb, one should list\\\\\\\\n    // files required for compilation plus any license(s).\\\\\\\\n    // Paths are relative to the build root. Use the empty string (&#96;\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"&#96;) to refer to\\\\\\\\n    // the build root itself.\\\\\\\\n    // A directory listed here means that all files within, recursively, are included.\\\\\\\\n    .paths = .{\\\\\\\\n        \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"build.zig\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n        \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"build.zig.zon\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n        \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"src\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n        \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"LICENSE\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n        // \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"README.md\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n    },\\\\\\\\n}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":81}\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"bc619e19-02cb-4a4f-98f9-d0eb1ddd685e\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"88b27b67-f492-41ff-8e09-27b9633dca6a\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-02-19T17:18:12.369Z\\\",\\\"mcpDescriptors\\\":[],\\\"workspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"conversationState\\\":{\\\"rootPromptMessagesJson\\\":[],\\\"turnsOld\\\" z-plug\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAudio plugin framework for Zig. Write a plugin once, get VST3 and CLAP binaries from the same source. Inspired by [nih-plug](https://github.com/robbert-vdh/nih-plug).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRequires Zig 0.15.2.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Example\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nA minimal gain plugin (&#96;examples/gain.zig&#96;):\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;zig\\\\\\\\nconst z_plug = @import(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"z_plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\");\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nconst GainPlugin = struct {\\\\\\\\n    pub const name: [:0]const u8 = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Zig Gain\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\";\\\\\\\\n    pub const vendor: [:0]const u8 = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"zig-plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\";\\\\\\\\n    pub const url: [:0]const u8 = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"https://github.com/example/zig-plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\";\\\\\\\\n    pub const version: [:0]const u8 = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"0.1.0\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\";\\\\\\\\n    pub const plugin_id: [:0]const u8 = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"com.zig-plug.gain\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\";\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    pub const audio_io_layouts = &amp;[_]z_plug.AudioIOLayout{\\\\\\\\n        z_plug.AudioIOLayout.STEREO,\\\\\\\\n    };\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    pub const params = &amp;[_]z_plug.Param{\\\\\\\\n        .{ .float = .{\\\\\\\\n            .name = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Gain\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n            .id = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"gain\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n            .default = 0.0,\\\\\\\\n            .range = .{ .linear = .{ .min = -60.0, .max = 24.0 } },\\\\\\\\n            .unit = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"dB\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n            .smoothing = .{ .logarithmic = 50.0 },\\\\\\\\n        } },\\\\\\\\n    };\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    pub fn init(_: *@This(), _: *const z_plug.AudioIOLayout, _: *const z_plug.BufferConfig) bool {\\\\\\\\n        return true;\\\\\\\\n    }\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    pub fn deinit(_: *@This()) void {}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    pub fn process(\\\\\\\\n        _: *@This(),\\\\\\\\n        buffer: *z_plug.Buffer,\\\\\\\\n        _: *z_plug.AuxBuffers,\\\\\\\\n        context: *z_plug.ProcessContext,\\\\\\\\n    ) z_plug.ProcessStatus {\\\\\\\\n        const num_samples = buffer.num_samples;\\\\\\\\n        const num_channels = buffer.channel_data.len;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n        var i: usize = 0;\\\\\\\\n        while (i &lt; num_samples) : (i += 1) {\\\\\\\\n            const gain = z_plug.util.dbToGainFast(context.nextSmoothed(1, 0));\\\\\\\\n            for (buffer.channel_data[0..num_channels]) |channel| {\\\\\\\\n                channel[i] *= gain;\\\\\\\\n            }\\\\\\\\n        }\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n        return z_plug.ProcessStatus.ok();\\\\\\\\n    }\\\\\\\\n};\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\ncomptime { _ = z_plug.ClapEntry(GainPlugin); }\\\\\\\\ncomptime { _ = z_plug.Vst3Factory(GainPlugin); }\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nPlugin metadata, parameters, and audio layout are declared as comptime constants. The framework generates vtables, parameter lists, GUIDs, and lookup tables at compile time. No allocations happen on the audio thread. The &#96;util.dbToGainFast&#96; conversion turns the dB parameter into a linear gain factor in the inner loop.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nSee [&#96;examples/super_gain.zig&#96;](examples/super_gain.zig) for a more complete showcase: dB-scale gain with logarithmic smoothing, mid-side stereo width, platform-adaptive SIMD, denormal flushing, block-based processing, and channel routing.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Building\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe &#96;flake.nix&#96; provides a dev environment with the right Zig version via Nix + direnv.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\\\\\\\\n# Set up nix + direnv, then run this in the project root:\\\\\\\\ndirenv allow\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Build example plugins (outputs to plugins/)\\\\\\\\nzig build\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Run tests\\\\\\\\nzig build test\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Install plugins to user directories (automatically signs on macOS)\\\\\\\\nzig build install-plugins\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Install to system directories (requires sudo, automatically signs on macOS)\\\\\\\\nzig build install-plugins -Dsystem=true\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Sign plugins on macOS without installing (optional - install-plugins does this automatically)\\\\\\\\nzig build sign-plugins\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Uninstall\\\\\\\\nzig build uninstall-plugins\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nSee [docs/getting-started.md](docs/getting-started.md) for more.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Project Structure\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\nsrc/\\\\\\\\n  core/              # Framework core (format-agnostic)\\\\\\\\n    plugin.zig       # Plugin interface &amp; comptime validation\\\\\\\\n    params.zig       # Parameter system with smoothing\\\\\\\\n    buffer.zig       # Audio buffer abstraction\\\\\\\\n    events.zig       # Unified note/MIDI events\\\\\\\\n    state.zig        # State persistence\\\\\\\\n    audio_layout.zig # Audio I/O configuration\\\\\\\\n  bindings/\\\\\\\\n    clap/            # CLAP C API bindings (LGPL v3)\\\\\\\\n    vst3/            # VST3 C API bindings (MIT)\\\\\\\\n  wrappers/          # Format-specific wrappers\\\\\\\\n    clap/            # CLAP wrapper\\\\\\\\n    vst3/            # VST3 wrapper\\\\\\\\n    common.zig       # Shared wrapper utilities\\\\\\\\n  root.zig           # Public API\\\\\\\\nexamples/\\\\\\\\n  gain.zig           # Minimal gain plugin (CLAP + VST3)\\\\\\\\n  super_gain.zig     # Feature showcase (dB gain, width, SIMD, etc.)\\\\\\\\nbuild.zig            # Build system with addPlugin() helper\\\\\\\\nbuild_tools/         # Install/sign/uninstall scripts\\\\\\\\ndocs/                # Documentation\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Documentation\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- [docs/plugin-authors.md](docs/plugin-authors.md) -- writing plugins with z-plug\\\\\\\\n- [docs/getting-started.md](docs/getting-started.md) -- dev environment setup\\\\\\\\n- [docs/architecture.md](docs/architecture.md) -- how the layers fit together\\\\\\\\n- [AGENTS.md](AGENTS.md) -- coding standards\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Status\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe core framework, both wrappers, and the build system work. The example gain plugin loads and runs in DAWs. Still to do: \\\\\\\\n- UI support\\\\\\\\n- more example plugins\\\\\\\\n- probably many other things and stuff yet to be determined\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis is an **mvp** implementation and a lot of the framework is wholly untested, use at your own risk.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## License\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFramework code is licensed under the [Mozilla Public License 2.0](LICENSE).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**CLAP bindings** (&#96;src/bindings/clap/&#96;): derived from [clap-zig-bindings](https://git.sr.ht/~interpunct/clap-zig-bindings), GNU LGPL v3.0+. See &#96;src/bindings/clap/LICENSE&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**VST3 bindings** (&#96;src/bindings/vst3/&#96;): based on [Steinberg vst3_c_api](https://github.com/steinbergmedia/vst3_c_api), MIT. See &#96;src/bindings/vst3/LICENSE&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":150}\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"eb74efec-8da2-4a74-b045-df25fae19c18\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"3ca01ece-4f94-47e8-bec5-1b25c800bac3\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-02-19T17:18:12.369Z\\\",\\\"mcpDescriptors\\\":[],\\\"workspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"conversationState\\\":{\\\"rootPromptMessagesJson\\\":[],\\\"turnsOld\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"pendingToolCalls\\\":[],\\\"turns\\\":[],\\\"previousWorkspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"fileStates\\\":{},\\\"summaryArchives\\\":[],\\\"turnTimings\\\":[],\\\"fileStatesV2\\\":{},\\\"subagentStates\\\":{},\\\"selfSummaryCount\\\":0,\\\"readPaths\\\":[]},\\\"text\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"toolFormerData\\\":{\\\"toolCallId\\\":\\\"tool_a6c33ec5-5417-47ec-88d0-8cb57f8b9f1\\\",\\\"toolIndex\\\":0,\\\"modelCallId\\\":\\\"tool_a6c33ec5-5417-47ec-88d0-8cb57f8b9f1\\\",\\\"status\\\":\\\"completed\\\",\\\"name\\\":\\\"read_file_v2\\\",\\\"rawArgs\\\":\\\"{\\\\\\\"path\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"/Users/b/code/z-plug/src/core/README.md\\\\\\\"}\\\",\\\"tool\\\":40,\\\"params\\\":\\\"{\\\\\\\"targetFile\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"/Users/b/code/z-plug/src/core/README.md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"charsLimit\\\\\\\":1000000,\\\\\\\"effectiveUri\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"/Users/b/code/z-plug/src/core/README.md\\\\\\\"}\\\",\\\"result\\\":\\\"{\\\\\\\"contents\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"# Framework Core Module\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe framework core provides API-agnostic types that plugin authors interact with. No format-specific code (CLAP or VST3) belongs in this layer.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Purpose\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis module defines the plugin interface and all core abstractions:\\\\\\\\n- Comptime plugin validation (&#96;Plugin(T)&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- Audio buffer wrapper (&#96;Buffer&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- Unified note/MIDI events (&#96;NoteEvent&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- Parameter system (&#96;Param&#96;, &#96;ParamValues&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- State persistence (&#96;SaveContext&#96;, &#96;LoadContext&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- Audio I/O configuration (&#96;AudioIOLayout&#96;, &#96;BufferConfig&#96;, &#96;Transport&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- Platform constants (&#96;CACHE_LINE_SIZE&#96;, &#96;SIMD_VEC_LEN&#96;, &#96;F32xV&#96;)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nPlugin authors import these types via &#96;@import(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"z_plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")&#96;, which re-exports from this module.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDSP utilities (conversions, metering, STFT) are in a separate &#96;src/dsp/&#96; module (see [&#96;src/dsp/README.md&#96;](../dsp/README.md)).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Files\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n| File | Purpose |\\\\\\\\n|------|---------|\\\\\\\\n| &#96;plugin.zig&#96; | Plugin interface, comptime validation, &#96;ProcessContext&#96;, &#96;ProcessStatus&#96;, &#96;EventOutputList&#96; |\\\\\\\\n| &#96;params.zig&#96; | Parameter declarations (&#96;Param&#96;, &#96;FloatParam&#96;, &#96;IntParam&#96;, &#96;BoolParam&#96;, &#96;ChoiceParam&#96;), ranges (linear + logarithmic), flags, smoothing, atomic parameter storage |\\\\\\\\n| &#96;buffer.zig&#96; | Zero-copy audio buffer abstraction with three iteration strategies |\\\\\\\\n| &#96;events.zig&#96; | Unified &#96;NoteEvent&#96; tagged union with factory functions (note on/off, poly expression, MIDI CC, etc.) |\\\\\\\\n| &#96;state.zig&#96; | State save/load interface (&#96;SaveContext&#96;, &#96;LoadContext&#96;) using Zig 0.15.2 I/O |\\\\\\\\n| &#96;audio_layout.zig&#96; | Audio I/O layouts, buffer config, process modes, MIDI config, transport info |\\\\\\\\n| &#96;platform.zig&#96; | Platform constants: &#96;CACHE_LINE_SIZE&#96;, &#96;SIMD_VEC_LEN&#96;, &#96;F32xV&#96; |\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Key Types\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Plugin Interface\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;Plugin(comptime T)&#96;**  Comptime function that validates a plugin struct &#96;T&#96; at compile time using duck-typing (similar to &#96;std.mem.Allocator&#96; pattern). Emits clear &#96;@compileError&#96; messages for missing or wrong-typed declarations.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;ProcessContext&#96;**  Passed to &#96;process&#96;, contains transport info, input events, output event list, sample rate, and parameter access methods (&#96;getFloat&#96;, &#96;getInt&#96;, &#96;getBool&#96;, &#96;getChoice&#96;, &#96;nextSmoothed&#96;).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;ProcessStatus&#96;**  Return type from &#96;process&#96;: &#96;normal&#96;, &#96;silence&#96;, &#96;tail&#96;, &#96;keep_alive&#96;, &#96;err&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;EventOutputList&#96;**  Bounded push-only list for output events.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Buffer and Audio I/O\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;Buffer&#96;**  Zero-copy wrapper over host audio data (&#96;[][]f32&#96;). Provides raw slice access, per-sample iteration, and per-block iteration.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;AuxBuffers&#96;**  Auxiliary I/O buses (sidechain inputs, aux outputs).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;AudioIOLayout&#96;**  Declares supported channel configurations (main input/output, aux buses).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;BufferConfig&#96;**  Runtime config from host (sample rate, buffer size, process mode).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;Transport&#96;**  Unified transport/timeline info (playing, tempo, time signature, position).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Events\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;NoteEvent&#96;**  Tagged union unifying CLAP and VST3 events:\\\\\\\\n  - Note events: &#96;note_on&#96;, &#96;note_off&#96;, &#96;choke&#96;, &#96;voice_terminated&#96;\\\\\\\\n  - Poly expression: &#96;poly_pressure&#96;, &#96;poly_tuning&#96;, &#96;poly_vibrato&#96;, &#96;poly_expression&#96;, &#96;poly_brightness&#96;, &#96;poly_volume&#96;, &#96;poly_pan&#96;\\\\\\\\n  - MIDI: &#96;midi_cc&#96;, &#96;midi_channel_pressure&#96;, &#96;midi_pitch_bend&#96;, &#96;midi_program_change&#96;\\\\\\\\n- All events carry sample-accurate &#96;timing&#96; (offset within buffer).\\\\\\\\n- **Factory functions**: &#96;noteOn()&#96;, &#96;noteOff()&#96;, &#96;chokeNote()&#96;, &#96;voiceTerminated()&#96;, &#96;polyPressure()&#96;, &#96;polyTuning()&#96;, &#96;polyVibrato()&#96;, &#96;polyExpression()&#96;, &#96;polyBrightness()&#96;, &#96;polyVolume()&#96;, &#96;polyPan()&#96;, &#96;midiCC()&#96;, &#96;midiChannelPressure()&#96;, &#96;midiPitchBend()&#96;, &#96;midiProgramChange()&#96;  used by wrappers for uniform event construction.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Parameters\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;Param&#96;**  Tagged union for parameter declarations: &#96;float&#96;, &#96;int&#96;, &#96;boolean&#96;, &#96;choice&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;FloatRange&#96;**  Linear value range with normalize/unnormalize/clamp methods.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;LogFloatRange&#96;**  Logarithmic value range for perceptually uniform parameters (frequency, gain). Normalizes/unnormalizes in log space.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;IntRange&#96;**  Discrete integer range with normalize/unnormalize/clamp/stepCount methods.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;FloatParam.range&#96;**  Tagged union: &#96;.linear&#96; (FloatRange) or &#96;.logarithmic&#96; (LogFloatRange).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;ParamFlags&#96;**  Packed struct controlling automation, modulation, visibility, bypass.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;ParamValues(comptime N)&#96;**  Lock-free atomic storage for runtime parameter values. Uses &#96;std.atomic.Value(f32)&#96; for thread-safe access between main and audio threads. Cache-line aligned for performance.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;SmoothingStyle&#96;**  Tagged union for parameter smoothing: &#96;.linear&#96; (ms), &#96;.exponential&#96; (ms), &#96;.logarithmic&#96; (ms), &#96;.none&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;Smoother&#96;**  Single-parameter smoother with configurable style and step rate. Hot-path methods are inlined.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;SmootherBank(comptime N)&#96;**  Collection of N smoothers for plugin parameters. Cache-line aligned.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;ParamAccess&#96;**  Helper for accessing parameter values in the audio thread.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;idHash(comptime id)&#96;**  Stable FNV-1a hash for generating VST3 &#96;ParamID&#96; from string IDs.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Platform\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;CACHE_LINE_SIZE&#96;**  L2 cache line size: 128 bytes on aarch64 (Apple Silicon), 64 bytes on x86_64.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;SIMD_VEC_LEN&#96;**  Optimal SIMD vector length for f32 (uses &#96;std.simd.suggestVectorLength&#96;).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;F32xV&#96;**  Platform-optimal &#96;@Vector(SIMD_VEC_LEN, f32)&#96; type.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### State Persistence\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;SaveContext&#96;**  Type-erased writer (&#96;std.io.AnyWriter&#96;) with helper methods (&#96;write&#96;, &#96;writeString&#96;, &#96;writeBytes&#96;).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;LoadContext&#96;**  Type-erased reader (&#96;std.io.AnyReader&#96;) with helper methods (&#96;read&#96;, &#96;readString&#96;, &#96;readStringBounded&#96;). Includes &#96;version&#96; field for migration.\\\\\\\\n- The framework writes a header (magic bytes + version) before calling the plugin's &#96;save&#96; function.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Design Notes\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Comptime Validation\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe &#96;Plugin(comptime T)&#96; function uses &#96;@hasDecl&#96; and &#96;@TypeOf&#96; to validate plugin structs at compile time:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;zig\\\\\\\\nif (!@hasDecl(T, \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"name\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")) {\\\\\\\\n    @compileError(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Plugin '\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" ++ @typeName(T) ++ \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"' must declare 'pub const name: [:0]const u8'\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\");\\\\\\\\n}\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis provides:\\\\\\\\n- Zero runtime overhead (monomorphization, no vtables)\\\\\\\\n- Clear compile-time error messages\\\\\\\\n- No dynamic dispatch on the audio thread\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Atomic Parameters\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;ParamValues(N)&#96; uses &#96;std.atomic.Value(f32)&#96; for lock-free thread safety:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;zig\\\\\\\\npub fn get(self: *const Self, index: usize) f32 {\\\\\\\\n    return self.values[index].load(.monotonic);\\\\\\\\n}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\npub fn set(self: *Self, index: usize, normalized: f32) void {\\\\\\\\n    self.values[index].store(normalized, .monotonic);\\\\\\\\n}\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nMain thread writes with &#96;.store()&#96;, audio thread reads with &#96;.load()&#96;. No locks are ever acquired.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Zero-Copy Buffers\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;Buffer&#96; wraps pointers into the host's audio memory:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;zig\\\\\\\\npub const Buffer = struct {\\\\\\\\n    channel_data: [][]f32,  // Points into host memory, never copies\\\\\\\\n    num_samples: usize,\\\\\\\\n    // ...\\\\\\\\n};\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWrappers populate &#96;channel_data&#96; with pointers from format-specific structures (&#96;clap_audio_buffer_t&#96;, &#96;AudioBusBuffers&#96;). Audio samples are never copied.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Three Buffer Iteration Strategies\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Raw slice access**  Direct &#96;[]f32&#96; per channel for maximum control.\\\\\\\\n2. **Per-sample**  &#96;iterSamples()&#96; yields &#96;ChannelSamples&#96; for each sample index (convenient for per-sample SIMD or branching).\\\\\\\\n3. **Per-block**  &#96;iterBlocks(max_block_size)&#96; yields &#96;Block&#96; sub-buffers (useful for FFT, convolution, or algorithms that operate on fixed-size blocks).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Testing\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nEach file includes test blocks at the bottom covering:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;audio_layout.zig&#96;: Layout constants, total channel calculations\\\\\\\\n- &#96;events.zig&#96;: Helper methods (timing, channel, voiceId extraction), factory functions\\\\\\\\n- &#96;params.zig&#96;: Range normalize/unnormalize roundtrips (linear + logarithmic), idHash stability, ParamValues atomic access, smoother bank, parameter access\\\\\\\\n- &#96;buffer.zig&#96;: Iteration strategies, zero-copy pointer identity\\\\\\\\n- &#96;state.zig&#96;: SaveContext/LoadContext roundtrips, header validation\\\\\\\\n- &#96;plugin.zig&#96;: Comptime validation with valid and invalid plugin structs\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDSP module tests (util, metering, STFT) are in &#96;src/dsp/&#96; (see [&#96;src/dsp/README.md&#96;](../dsp/README.md)).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRun tests with:\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\\\\\\\\nzig build test\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## See Also\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- [&#96;src/dsp/README.md&#96;](../dsp/README.md)  DSP utilities and processors module\\\\\\\\n- [docs/architecture.md](../../docs/architecture.md)  How core fits into the overall architecture\\\\\\\\n- [docs/plugin-authors.md](../../docs/plugin-authors.md)  Public API guide for writing plugins\\\\\\\\n- [src/root.zig](../root.zig)  Public API DSP Building Blocks Module\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDSP utilities and processors for z-plug plugin authors. This module is located at &#96;src/dsp/&#96; and provides common building blocks for audio processing: utility functions, metering, and spectral processing.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Overview\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe &#96;dsp&#96; module is separate from the core plugin interface (&#96;src/core/&#96;) to clearly distinguish:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Core** (&#96;src/core/&#96;): Plugin interface contract (Buffer, Param, NoteEvent, etc.)  the API plugins must implement\\\\\\\\n- **DSP** (&#96;src/dsp/&#96;): Optional building blocks for plugin authors  utilities they can use but don't have to\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nPlatform constants (&#96;src/core/platform.zig&#96;) remain in &#96;core/&#96; because they're foundational  used by both core types and DSP utilities.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Module Structure\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\nsrc/dsp/\\\\\\\\n root.zig           # Namespace entry point\\\\\\\\n util/              # Audio DSP utility functions\\\\\\\\n    root.zig\\\\\\\\n    conversions.zig  # dB/gain, MIDI/freq, time/sample, pitch\\\\\\\\n    denormals.zig    # Flush-to-zero for denormal handling\\\\\\\\n metering/          # Real-time audio metering\\\\\\\\n    root.zig\\\\\\\\n    biquad.zig       # Biquad IIR filter (K-weighting)\\\\\\\\n    peak.zig         # PeakMeter\\\\\\\\n    rms.zig          # RmsMeter\\\\\\\\n    true_peak.zig    # TruePeakMeter (ITU-R BS.1770)\\\\\\\\n    lufs.zig         # LufsMeter (EBU R128)\\\\\\\\n stft/              # STFT spectral processing\\\\\\\\n     root.zig\\\\\\\\n     config.zig       # StftConfig, SpectralContext\\\\\\\\n     fft.zig          # KissFFT C interop\\\\\\\\n     processor.zig    # StftProcessor comptime generic\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Usage\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAll DSP modules are accessed via the &#96;z_plug.dsp.*&#96; namespace:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;zig\\\\\\\\nconst z_plug = @import(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"z_plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\");\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n// Utility functions\\\\\\\\nconst gain = z_plug.dsp.util.dbToGainFast(-6.0);\\\\\\\\nconst freq = z_plug.dsp.util.midiNoteToFreq(60); // Middle C\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n// Denormal flushing\\\\\\\\nconst ftz = z_plug.dsp.util.enableFlushToZero();\\\\\\\\ndefer z_plug.dsp.util.restoreFloatMode(ftz);\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n// Metering\\\\\\\\nvar peak_meter = z_plug.dsp.metering.PeakMeter.init(100.0, 500.0, 48000.0);\\\\\\\\npeak_meter.process(samples);\\\\\\\\nconst peak_db = peak_meter.readPeakDb();\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n// STFT processing\\\\\\\\nconst MyEffect = struct {\\\\\\\\n    pub const UserState = f32; // Per-bin state\\\\\\\\n    pub const Params = struct { threshold: f32 };\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n    pub fn processBins(\\\\\\\\n        bins: []z_plug.dsp.stft.Complex,\\\\\\\\n        magnitudes: []const f32,\\\\\\\\n        user_state: []f32,\\\\\\\\n        context: z_plug.dsp.stft.SpectralContext,\\\\\\\\n        params: Params,\\\\\\\\n    ) void {\\\\\\\\n        // Effect-specific spectral processing\\\\\\\\n    }\\\\\\\\n};\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nconst stft = z_plug.dsp.stft.StftProcessor(MyEffect, .{\\\\\\\\n    .fft_size = 1024,\\\\\\\\n    .hop_size = 256,\\\\\\\\n    .max_channels = 2,\\\\\\\\n});\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Backward Compatibility\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFor legacy code, &#96;z_plug.util&#96; and &#96;z_plug.metering&#96; are aliased to &#96;z_plug.dsp.util&#96; and &#96;z_plug.dsp.metering&#96;. New code should use the canonical &#96;z_plug.dsp.*&#96; namespace.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Modules\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### util (Utility Functions)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nZero-cost inline functions for common audio programming tasks:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **dB/gain conversions**: &#96;dbToGain&#96;, &#96;dbToGainFast&#96;, &#96;gainToDb&#96;, &#96;gainToDbFast&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **MIDI/frequency**: &#96;midiNoteToFreq&#96;, &#96;freqToMidiNote&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **Time/sample**: &#96;msToSamples&#96;, &#96;samplesToMs&#96;, &#96;bpmToHz&#96;, &#96;hzToBpm&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **Pitch**: &#96;semitonesToRatio&#96;, &#96;ratioToSemitones&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **Denormal flushing**: &#96;enableFlushToZero&#96;, &#96;restoreFloatMode&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAll functions are marked &#96;inline&#96; for zero overhead.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### metering (Real-Time Metering)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nReal-time-safe meters with pre-allocated buffers (no heap allocations):\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **PeakMeter**: Sample peak with hold and exponential decay\\\\\\\\n- **RmsMeter**: Running RMS with configurable window\\\\\\\\n- **TruePeakMeter**: ITU-R BS.1770 true peak via 4x oversampling (12-sample measurement latency)\\\\\\\\n- **LufsMeter**: Full EBU R128 loudness (momentary, short-term, integrated with gating)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAll meters are read-only (no signal modification) and conform to industry standards.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### stft (Spectral Processing)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nComptime-parameterized STFT engine that handles all the plumbing (ring buffers, windowing, KissFFT, overlap-add, SIMD) while letting plugin authors focus on spectral processing logic.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Key abstractions**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- &#96;StftProcessor(Effect, config)&#96;: Comptime generic that generates an STFT engine\\\\\\\\n- &#96;Effect&#96;: User-defined struct with &#96;processBins&#96; callback\\\\\\\\n- &#96;StftConfig&#96;: FFT size, hop size, max channels (comptime)\\\\\\\\n- &#96;SpectralContext&#96;: Sample rate, FFT size, hop size, num bins (runtime)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Effect interface** (comptime duck-typing):\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;zig\\\\\\\\nconst MyEffect = struct {\\\\\\\\n    // Optional: per-bin state type (default: void)\\\\\\\\n    pub const UserState = f32;\\\\\\\\n    pub const user_state_default: f32 = 0.0;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Optional: parameters passed to processBins (default: void)\\\\\\\\n    pub const Params = struct {\\\\\\\\n        threshold: f32,\\\\\\\\n        gain: f32,\\\\\\\\n    };\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Required: process frequency bins in-place\\\\\\\\n    pub fn processBins(\\\\\\\\n        bins: []Complex,              // Frequency bins (r+i)\\\\\\\\n        magnitudes: []const f32,       // Precomputed magnitudes\\\\\\\\n        user_state: []UserState,       // Per-bin state\\\\\\\\n        context: SpectralContext,      // FFT metadata\\\\\\\\n        params: Params,                // User parameters\\\\\\\\n    ) void {\\\\\\\\n        // Effect-specific processing\\\\\\\\n    }\\\\\\\\n};\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe STFT module uses KissFFT (BSD-3-Clause, vendored in &#96;vendor/kissfft/&#96;) for real-valued FFTs.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Dependencies\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Core**: Platform constants (&#96;src/core/platform.zig&#96;) for SIMD vector types and cache line sizes\\\\\\\\n- **KissFFT**: C library for FFT operations (used by &#96;stft&#96; module only, lazy compilation)\\\\\\\\n- **Standard library**: Math functions, memory operations, inline assembly (denormal flushing)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Design Principles\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Real-time safety**: No heap allocations in audio processing paths  all buffers pre-allocated during init\\\\\\\\n2. **SIMD everywhere**: Platform-adaptive vectorization for windowing, magnitude computation, overlap-add\\\\\\\\n3. **Comptime generics**: STFT processor uses duck-typing (like &#96;std.mem.Allocator&#96;) for type-safe, zero-cost abstraction\\\\\\\\n4. **Minimal overhead**: Inline functions, comptime dispatch, lazy compilation\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## See Also\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- [&#96;src/core/README.md&#96;](../core/README.md)  Core plugin interface module\\\\\\\\n- [&#96;docs/plugin-authors.md&#96;](../../docs/plugin-authors.md)  Public API guide for plugin authors\\\\\\\\n- [&#96;examples/spectral.zig&#96;](../../examples/spectral.zig)  Spectral gate example using STFT module\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":167}\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"0d29b21b-04a6-4f22-8f80-6000071bfdc2\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"6294a86f-aaa0-4879-89ed-4a82866e8cdb\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-02-19T17:18:12.369Z\\\",\\\"mcpDescriptors\\\":[],\\\"workspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"conversationState\\\":{\\\"rootPromptMessagesJson\\\":[],\\\"turnsOld\\\":[],\ VST3 Wrapper Module\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis module provides the VST3 (Virtual Studio Technology 3) wrapper that translates between the framework's API-agnostic plugin interface and the VST3 COM-based ABI.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Structure\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;com.zig&#96;**  COM (Component Object Model) helpers for reference counting and queryInterface\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;factory.zig&#96;**  Plugin factory export (&#96;GetPluginFactory&#96;) and IPluginFactory implementation\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;component.zig&#96;**  Combined IComponent + IAudioProcessor implementation (single-component model)\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;controller.zig&#96;**  IEditController implementation for parameter editing\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Key Types\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- &#96;Vst3Factory(comptime T)&#96;  Generates the &#96;GetPluginFactory&#96; export and factory COM object\\\\\\\\n- &#96;Vst3Component(comptime T)&#96;  The main wrapper struct implementing IComponent, IAudioProcessor, and IEditController\\\\\\\\n- &#96;Vst3Controller(comptime T)&#96;  Controller state for parameter management (embedded in component)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## How It Works\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. Host calls &#96;GetPluginFactory()&#96; which returns an &#96;IPluginFactory&#96; COM object\\\\\\\\n2. Factory provides class info and creates &#96;Vst3Component&#96; instances via &#96;createInstance()&#96;\\\\\\\\n3. Component implements three interfaces via COM queryInterface:\\\\\\\\n   - &#96;IComponent&#96;  Bus configuration, activation, state save/load\\\\\\\\n   - &#96;IAudioProcessor&#96;  Process callback, bus arrangements, latency/tail\\\\\\\\n   - &#96;IEditController&#96;  Parameter info, normalized/plain conversion\\\\\\\\n4. Process callback translates VST3 ProcessData to framework types, calls plugin, translates results back\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Design Notes\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **COM lifetime**: Atomic reference counting with proper release-acquire memory ordering. &#96;fetchSub&#96; uses &#96;.release&#96; ordering, with an &#96;.acquire&#96; fence before destroy.\\\\\\\\n- **Single-component model**: Same object implements processor and controller (simpler than split model)\\\\\\\\n- **GUID generation**: Plugin ID string hashed to deterministic 16-byte TUID\\\\\\\\n- **Zero-copy audio**: Channel pointers mapped directly from VST3 AudioBusBuffers to framework &#96;Buffer&#96;. Auxiliary bus buffers also use zero-copy slice mapping.\\\\\\\\n- **Shared utilities**: Uses &#96;common.zig&#96; for in-place buffer copy/zero-fill (&#96;copyInPlace&#96;), ProcessContext construction (&#96;buildProcessContext&#96;), and parameter normalization helpers\\\\\\\\n- **O(log N) parameter lookup**: Uses &#96;Plugin(T).findParamIndex()&#96; for binary search on comptime-sorted parameter IDs, avoiding O(N) linear scans per parameter change event\\\\\\\\n- **Parameter ID precomputation**: The wrapper precomputes all parameter IDs (hashes of string IDs) at comptime into a &#96;param_ids&#96; array, then uses array lookups instead of runtime calls to &#96;core.idHash(param.id())&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **Cache-line optimization**: &#96;Vst3Component&#96; struct layout groups hot audio data first, &#96;ref_count&#96; on a separate cache line (&#96;align(CACHE_LINE_SIZE)&#96;), cold data (vtables, controller) last\\\\\\\\n- **Event translation**: Uses &#96;NoteEvent&#96; factory functions (&#96;noteOn()&#96;, &#96;noteOff()&#96;, etc.) for uniform event construction from VST3 &#96;IEventList&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **Safe COM thunks**: Processor thunks use &#96;@fieldParentPtr&#96; via &#96;fromProcessor()&#96; instead of manual &#96;@offsetOf&#96; arithmetic\\\\\\\\n- **State persistence**: VST3 IBStream wrapped in &#96;std.io.AnyWriter&#96;/&#96;AnyReader&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **Platform-specific exports**: The factory exports platform-specific module init/deinit functions at comptime:\\\\\\\\n  - macOS: &#96;bundleEntry&#96;, &#96;bundleExit&#96;\\\\\\\\n  - Linux: &#96;ModuleEntry&#96;, &#96;ModuleExit&#96;\\\\\\\\n  - Windows: &#96;InitDll&#96;, &#96;ExitDll&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **macOS bundle structure**: The build system creates a proper VST3 bundle with &#96;Contents/MacOS/&#96;, &#96;Info.plist&#96;, and &#96;PkgInfo&#96; files\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## COM Interface Layout\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\nVst3Component\\\\\\\\n component_vtbl (IComponent)\\\\\\\\n processor_vtbl (IAudioProcessor)  \\\\\\\\n controller_interface (IEditController)\\\\\\\\n ref_count (atomic)\\\\\\\\n plugin (actual plugin instance)\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nqueryInterface returns different vtbl pointers depending on requested IID, but all point to the same component object.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":59}\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"a6dbf34a-9703-4c4b-8afb-537e9cdd89f8\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"496893af-825a-4751-be17-0f9163e6e9bc\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-02-19T17:18:12.370Z\\\",\\\"mcpDescriptors\\\":[],\\\"workspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"conversationState\\\":{\\\"rootPromptMessagesJson\\\":[],\\\"turnsOld\\\":[],\ CLAP Wrapper Module\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis module provides the CLAP (CLever Audio Plugin) wrapper that translates between the framework's API-agnostic plugin interface and the CLAP ABI.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Structure\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;entry.zig&#96;**  Entry point export (&#96;clap_entry&#96;) that hosts query when loading the plugin\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;factory.zig&#96;**  Plugin factory implementation for enumerating and creating plugin instances\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;plugin.zig&#96;**  Core wrapper struct that implements the &#96;clap_plugin&#96; interface and lifecycle\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;extensions.zig&#96;**  CLAP extension implementations (audio-ports, note-ports, params, state)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Key Types\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- &#96;ClapEntry(comptime T)&#96;  Generates the &#96;clap_entry&#96; export for plugin type &#96;T&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;ClapFactory(comptime T)&#96;  Generates the plugin factory with descriptor\\\\\\\\n- &#96;PluginWrapper(comptime T)&#96;  The main wrapper struct containing the plugin instance and CLAP state\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## How It Works\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. Host loads the &#96;.clap&#96; shared library and calls &#96;clap_entry.getFactory()&#96;\\\\\\\\n2. Factory provides plugin descriptor and creates &#96;PluginWrapper&#96; instances via &#96;createPlugin()&#96;\\\\\\\\n3. Host calls lifecycle methods (&#96;init&#96;, &#96;activate&#96;, &#96;process&#96;, &#96;deactivate&#96;, &#96;destroy&#96;)\\\\\\\\n4. Process callback translates CLAP events/buffers to framework types, calls plugin, translates results back\\\\\\\\n5. Extensions provide parameter info, audio/note port configuration, and state persistence\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Design Notes\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Zero-copy audio**: Channel pointers are mapped directly from CLAP buffers to framework &#96;Buffer&#96;. Auxiliary bus buffers also use zero-copy slice mapping (no data copies).\\\\\\\\n- **Event translation**: Events are translated from CLAP event types to the unified &#96;NoteEvent&#96; enum using factory functions (&#96;NoteEvent.noteOn()&#96;, etc.)\\\\\\\\n- **Shared utilities**: Uses &#96;common.zig&#96; for in-place buffer copy/zero-fill (&#96;copyInPlace&#96;), ProcessContext construction (&#96;buildProcessContext&#96;), and parameter normalization helpers (&#96;plainToNormalized&#96;/&#96;normalizedToPlain&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- **O(log N) parameter lookup**: Uses &#96;Plugin(T).findParamIndex()&#96; for binary search on comptime-sorted parameter IDs, avoiding O(N) linear scans per parameter change event\\\\\\\\n- **Parameter ID precomputation**: The wrapper precomputes all parameter IDs (hashes of string IDs) at comptime into a &#96;param_ids&#96; array, then uses array lookups instead of runtime calls to &#96;core.idHash(param.id())&#96;\\\\\\\\n- **Cache-line optimization**: &#96;PluginWrapper&#96; struct layout groups hot audio data first, with &#96;param_values&#96; cache-line aligned to prevent false sharing\\\\\\\\n- **Atomic parameter storage**: &#96;ParamValues&#96; provides thread-safe access between main and audio threads\\\\\\\\n- **State save/load**: Wraps CLAP streams in &#96;std.io.AnyWriter&#96;/&#96;AnyReader&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":36}\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"cc06a0c1-2be1-4bef-89ea-d08f7c9d22ae\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"d7817a18-54f0-44f9-abf6-85e54bdaf7a1\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-02-19T17:18:12.370Z\\\",\\\"mcpDescriptors\\\":[],\\\"workspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"conversationState\\\":{\\\"rootPromptMe VST3 Bindings Module\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHand-written idiomatic Zig bindings for Steinberg's VST3 C API.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Purpose\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis module provides Zig bindings for the [VST3 C API](https://github.com/steinbergmedia/vst3_c_api). The bindings are:\\\\\\\\n- **Hand-written**  Idiomatic Zig translations of ~15 core VST3 interfaces\\\\\\\\n- **Comptime-driven**  GUID parsing and vtable generation via comptime metaprogramming\\\\\\\\n- **Thin and mechanical**  No framework logic; pure ABI translation\\\\\\\\n- **COM-compatible**  Implements &#96;FUnknown&#96; pattern with &#96;queryInterface&#96; and reference counting\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## License\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Based on:** [Steinberg vst3_c_api](https://github.com/steinbergmedia/vst3_c_api)\\\\\\\\n- **License:** MIT (as of October 2025, VST3 moved to MIT licensing)\\\\\\\\n- Implementation is hand-written based on the upstream C API structure\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Structure\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\nsrc/bindings/vst3/\\\\\\\\n root.zig              # Root module, re-exports all types\\\\\\\\n types.zig             # Fundamental types (tresult, TUID, ParamID, Sample32/64, etc.)\\\\\\\\n guid.zig              # GUID parsing, TUID constants\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n funknown.zig          # FUnknown base interface (IID, queryInterface, addRef, release)\\\\\\\\n factory.zig           # IPluginFactory, IPluginFactory2, IPluginFactory3\\\\\\\\n component.zig         # IComponent (plugin lifecycle, bus info, routing)\\\\\\\\n processor.zig         # IAudioProcessor (setupProcessing, process, getTailSamples)\\\\\\\\n controller.zig        # IEditController (parameters, UI state)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n events.zig            # IEventList, Event (note on/off, data, poly pressure)\\\\\\\\n param_changes.zig     # IParameterChanges, IParamValueQueue\\\\\\\\n stream.zig            # IBStream (state I/O)\\\\\\\\n connection.zig        # IConnectionPoint (processor  controller messages)\\\\\\\\n view.zig              # IPlugView (GUI embedding)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n layout_tests.zig      # Test struct layouts match upstream\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Key Types\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Fundamental Types (types.zig)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;tresult&#96;**  &#96;i32&#96; result code. Constants: &#96;kResultOk&#96;, &#96;kResultFalse&#96;, &#96;kNoInterface&#96;, &#96;kInvalidArgument&#96;, etc.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;TUID&#96;**  &#96;[16]u8&#96;  UUID/GUID for interface identification.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;ParamID&#96;**  &#96;u32&#96;  Parameter identifier.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;ParamValue&#96;**  &#96;f64&#96;  Normalized parameter value (0.01.0).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;Sample32&#96;, &#96;Sample64&#96;**  &#96;f32&#96;, &#96;f64&#96;  Audio sample types.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;SampleRate&#96;**  &#96;f64&#96;  Sample rate in Hz.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;TSamples&#96;**  &#96;i64&#96;  Sample count.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;TQuarterNotes&#96;**  &#96;f64&#96;  Musical time in quarter notes.\\\\\\\\n- **Enums:** &#96;MediaTypes&#96;, &#96;BusDirections&#96;, &#96;BusTypes&#96;, &#96;IoModes&#96;, &#96;SymbolicSampleSizes&#96;, &#96;ProcessModes&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### COM Base (funknown.zig)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;FUnknown&#96;**  Base interface with vtable:\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;queryInterface(iid: *const TUID, obj: **anyopaque) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;addRef() u32&#96;\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;release() u32&#96;\\\\\\\\n- All VST3 interfaces inherit from &#96;FUnknown&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- Use &#96;guid.zig&#96; for comptime GUID generation from string IDs.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Factory Interfaces (factory.zig)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;IPluginFactory&#96;**  Basic plugin factory (get plugin count, info, create instance).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;IPluginFactory2&#96;**  Extended with &#96;getClassInfo2&#96; (subcategories, SDK version).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;IPluginFactory3&#96;**  Extended with &#96;getClassInfoUnicode&#96; (Unicode metadata).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;GetPluginFactory()&#96;**  Exported function that returns &#96;*IPluginFactory&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Core Plugin Interfaces\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**IComponent** (&#96;component.zig&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- Plugin lifecycle: &#96;initialize&#96;, &#96;terminate&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Bus management: &#96;getBusCount&#96;, &#96;getBusInfo&#96;, &#96;activateBus&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Routing: &#96;getRoutingInfo&#96;, &#96;setIoMode&#96;, &#96;setActive&#96;\\\\\\\\n- State: &#96;getState&#96;, &#96;setState&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**IAudioProcessor** (&#96;processor.zig&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- Processing setup: &#96;setBusArrangements&#96;, &#96;getBusArrangement&#96;, &#96;setupProcessing&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Process control: &#96;setProcessing&#96;, &#96;process&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Latency/tail: &#96;getLatencySamples&#96;, &#96;getTailSamples&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**IEditController** (&#96;controller.zig&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- Parameter management: &#96;getParameterCount&#96;, &#96;getParameterInfo&#96;, &#96;setParamNormalized&#96;, &#96;getParamNormalized&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Value conversion: &#96;normalizedParamToPlain&#96;, &#96;plainParamToNormalized&#96;, &#96;getParamStringByValue&#96;\\\\\\\\n- UI state: &#96;setComponentState&#96;, &#96;setState&#96;, &#96;getState&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Process Data (processor.zig)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**&#96;ProcessData&#96;**  Passed to &#96;IAudioProcessor::process&#96;:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;process_mode&#96;  Realtime, offline, prefetch\\\\\\\\n- &#96;symbolic_sample_size&#96;  32-bit or 64-bit samples\\\\\\\\n- &#96;num_samples&#96;  Number of samples to process\\\\\\\\n- &#96;num_inputs&#96;, &#96;num_outputs&#96;  Bus counts\\\\\\\\n- &#96;inputs&#96;, &#96;outputs&#96;  &#96;AudioBusBuffers&#96; arrays\\\\\\\\n- &#96;input_parameter_changes&#96;, &#96;output_parameter_changes&#96;  &#96;IParameterChanges&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;input_events&#96;, &#96;output_events&#96;  &#96;IEventList&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;process_context&#96;  Transport, tempo, time signature, position\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**&#96;AudioBusBuffers&#96;**  Non-interleaved audio buffer:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;num_channels&#96;  Channel count\\\\\\\\n- &#96;silence_flags&#96;  Bitmask indicating silent channels\\\\\\\\n- &#96;channel_buffers_32&#96;, &#96;channel_buffers_64&#96;  Audio data pointers\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**&#96;ProcessContext&#96;**  Transport and timeline info:\\\\\\\\n- State flags: &#96;kPlaying&#96;, &#96;kCycleActive&#96;, &#96;kRecording&#96;, etc.\\\\\\\\n- Time: &#96;project_time_samples&#96;, &#96;continuous_time_samples&#96;, &#96;project_time_music&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Tempo: &#96;tempo&#96; (BPM), &#96;tempo_increment&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Time signature: &#96;time_sig_numerator&#96;, &#96;time_sig_denominator&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Loop: &#96;cycle_start_music&#96;, &#96;cycle_end_music&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Events (events.zig)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**&#96;Event&#96;**  Generic event structure with union containing:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;NoteOnEvent&#96;  Note on with velocity, tuning, length, note ID\\\\\\\\n- &#96;NoteOffEvent&#96;  Note off with velocity, tuning, note ID\\\\\\\\n- &#96;DataEvent&#96;  Sysex or other data events\\\\\\\\n- &#96;PolyPressureEvent&#96;  Per-note aftertouch\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**&#96;IEventList&#96;**  Event list interface:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;getEventCount() i32&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;getEvent(index: i32, e: *Event) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;addEvent(e: *const Event) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Parameters (param_changes.zig)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**&#96;IParameterChanges&#96;**  Container for parameter change queues:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;getParameterCount() i32&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;getParameterData(index: i32) ?*IParamValueQueue&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;addParameterData(id: *ParamID, index: *i32) ?*IParamValueQueue&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**&#96;IParamValueQueue&#96;**  Sample-accurate parameter automation:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;getParameterId() ParamID&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;getPointCount() i32&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;getPoint(index: i32, sample_offset: *i32, value: *ParamValue) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;addPoint(sample_offset: i32, value: ParamValue, index: *i32) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### State (stream.zig)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**&#96;IBStream&#96;**  Stream interface for state save/load:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;read(buffer: *anyopaque, num_bytes: i32, num_bytes_read: *i32) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;write(buffer: *const anyopaque, num_bytes: i32, num_bytes_written: *i32) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;seek(pos: i64, mode: i32, result: *i64) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n- &#96;tell(pos: *i64) tresult&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Usage by Wrappers\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe VST3 wrapper (&#96;src/wrappers/vst3/&#96;) uses these bindings to implement the COM ABI:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Export &#96;GetPluginFactory()&#96;** returning &#96;*IPluginFactory&#96;.\\\\\\\\n2. **Implement factory** to create plugin component instances.\\\\\\\\n3. **Implement &#96;IComponent&#96;** with bus management, activation, state.\\\\\\\\n4. **Implement &#96;IAudioProcessor&#96;** with &#96;process&#96; delegating to framework core.\\\\\\\\n5. **Implement &#96;IEditController&#96;** for parameter management and UI state.\\\\\\\\n6. **Translate events** from &#96;IEventList&#96; to framework &#96;NoteEvent&#96;.\\\\\\\\n7. **Map audio buffers** from &#96;AudioBusBuffers&#96; to framework &#96;Buffer&#96; (zero-copy).\\\\\\\\n8. **Handle COM reference counting** using &#96;FUnknown&#96; pattern.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Zig 0.15.2 Compatibility\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThese bindings are written for Zig 0.15.2:\\\\\\\\n- All &#96;extern struct&#96; function pointer fields use explicit &#96;callconv(.c)&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- GUID parsing is done at comptime using &#96;guid.zig&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- No &#96;usingnamespace&#96; (removed from Zig).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Testing\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe bindings include layout tests verifying struct sizes and offsets match the upstream C API. Run with:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\\\\\\\\nzig build test\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nVST3 bindings tests are part of the main test suite (2 tests from this module).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## See Also\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **[VST3 C API](https://github.com/steinbergmedia/vst3_c_api)**  Official C API headers\\\\\\\\n- **[VST3 SDK](https://github.com/steinbergmedia/vst3sdk)**  Full SDK with C++ implementation and examples\\\\\\\\n- **[VST3 Developer Portal](https://steinbergmedia.github.io/vst3_dev_portal/)**  Official architecture\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":185}\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"9ce37d79-609f-4a8c-8812-c72999dba470\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"c099acc0-4dfa-49f0-b79d-9d12933cd229\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-02-19T17:18:12.370Z\\\",\\\"mcpDescriptors\\\":[],\\\"workspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"conversationState\\\":{\\\"rootPromptMessagesJson\\\":[],\\\"turnsOld\\\ CLAP Bindings Module\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nLow-level idiomatic Zig translation of the CLAP 1.2.2 C API.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Purpose\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis module provides direct Zig bindings for the [CLAP (CLever Audio Plug-in)](https://github.com/free-audio/clap) C API. The bindings are:\\\\\\\\n- **Thin and mechanical**  Direct translation of C structs and function pointers to Zig &#96;extern struct&#96; types\\\\\\\\n- **Idiomatic Zig**  Uses Zig naming conventions, &#96;callconv(.c)&#96; for function pointers, proper null safety\\\\\\\\n- **No framework logic**  Pure ABI translation; wrappers in &#96;src/wrappers/clap/&#96; add framework integration\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Origin and License\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Derived from:** [clap-zig-bindings](https://git.sr.ht/~interpunct/clap-zig-bindings) by interpunct\\\\\\\\n- **Modifications:** Adapted for Zig 0.15.2 compatibility (explicit &#96;callconv(.c)&#96;, no &#96;usingnamespace&#96;)\\\\\\\\n- **License:** GNU LGPL v3.0 or later\\\\\\\\n- See [LICENSE](LICENSE) and [NOTICE](NOTICE) for full attribution\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### LGPL Compliance\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWhen distributing binaries or using this framework, you must comply with LGPL v3 requirements. Users must be able to replace the LGPL-licensed library. This is satisfied by:\\\\\\\\n1. **Distributing source code** (recommended for open source projects), or\\\\\\\\n2. **Using dynamic linking** for the CLAP bindings portion\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Structure\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\nsrc/bindings/clap/\\\\\\\\n main.zig              # Root module, re-exports all types\\\\\\\\n LICENSE               # GNU LGPL v3.0 license text\\\\\\\\n NOTICE                # Attribution to original authors\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n version.zig           # CLAP version struct\\\\\\\\n entry.zig             # clap_entry (plugin entry point)\\\\\\\\n plugin.zig            # clap_plugin (plugin descriptor + vtable)\\\\\\\\n host.zig              # clap_host (host callbacks)\\\\\\\\n process.zig           # clap_process_t (audio processing context)\\\\\\\\n stream.zig            # clap_istream_t, clap_ostream_t (state I/O)\\\\\\\\n events.zig            # Event types (note, param, transport, MIDI)\\\\\\\\n audio_buffer.zig      # clap_audio_buffer_t (32/64-bit audio data)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n factory/\\\\\\\\n    plugin.zig        # clap_plugin_factory_t\\\\\\\\n    preset_discovery.zig  # clap_preset_discovery_factory_t\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n ext/                  # CLAP extensions (30+ files)\\\\\\\\n     params.zig        # clap_plugin_params extension\\\\\\\\n     state.zig         # clap_plugin_state extension\\\\\\\\n     audio_ports.zig   # clap_plugin_audio_ports extension\\\\\\\\n     note_ports.zig    # clap_plugin_note_ports extension\\\\\\\\n     gui.zig           # clap_plugin_gui extension\\\\\\\\n     latency.zig       # clap_plugin_latency extension\\\\\\\\n     tail.zig          # clap_plugin_tail extension\\\\\\\\n     ... (25+ more extension files)\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Key Types\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Core Plugin Types\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_entry&#96;** (&#96;entry.zig&#96;)  Plugin entry point struct with &#96;init&#96;, &#96;deinit&#96;, &#96;get_factory&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin&#96;** (&#96;plugin.zig&#96;)  Plugin descriptor with metadata and vtable (function pointers for &#96;activate&#96;, &#96;deactivate&#96;, &#96;start_processing&#96;, &#96;stop_processing&#96;, &#96;process&#96;, etc.).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_host&#96;** (&#96;host.zig&#96;)  Host callbacks provided to the plugin.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin_factory&#96;** (&#96;factory/plugin.zig&#96;)  Factory for creating plugin instances.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Process and Audio\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_process_t&#96;** (&#96;process.zig&#96;)  Audio processing context containing:\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;frames_count&#96;  Number of samples to process\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;audio_inputs&#96;, &#96;audio_outputs&#96;  Audio buffer arrays\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;in_events&#96;, &#96;out_events&#96;  Event lists (input/output)\\\\\\\\n  - &#96;transport&#96;  Transport info (optional)\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_audio_buffer_t&#96;** (&#96;audio_buffer.zig&#96;)  Non-interleaved audio buffer (32-bit or 64-bit float).\\\\\\\\n- **Status enum:** &#96;CLAP_PROCESS_ERROR&#96;, &#96;CLAP_PROCESS_CONTINUE&#96;, &#96;CLAP_PROCESS_CONTINUE_IF_NOT_QUIET&#96;, &#96;CLAP_PROCESS_TAIL&#96;, &#96;CLAP_PROCESS_SLEEP&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Events\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAll in &#96;events.zig&#96;:\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_event_header_t&#96;**  Common header for all events (size, time, space_id, type, flags).\\\\\\\\n- **Note events:** &#96;clap_event_note_t&#96; (note on/off/choke/end).\\\\\\\\n- **Note expression:** &#96;clap_event_note_expression_t&#96; (volume, pan, tuning, vibrato, etc.).\\\\\\\\n- **Parameters:** &#96;clap_event_param_value_t&#96;, &#96;clap_event_param_mod_t&#96;, &#96;clap_event_param_gesture_begin/end_t&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- **Transport:** &#96;clap_event_transport_t&#96; (tempo, time signature, position, loop points).\\\\\\\\n- **MIDI:** &#96;clap_event_midi_t&#96;, &#96;clap_event_midi_sysex_t&#96;, &#96;clap_event_midi2_t&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Extensions\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCLAP uses an extension-based architecture. Common extensions include:\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin_params&#96;** (&#96;ext/params.zig&#96;)  Parameter info, value queries, text conversion.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin_state&#96;** (&#96;ext/state.zig&#96;)  State save/load via streams.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin_audio_ports&#96;** (&#96;ext/audio_ports.zig&#96;)  Audio bus info (channel counts, names).\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin_note_ports&#96;** (&#96;ext/note_ports.zig&#96;)  Note input/output port info.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin_gui&#96;** (&#96;ext/gui.zig&#96;)  GUI creation, embedding, resizing.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin_latency&#96;** (&#96;ext/latency.zig&#96;)  Report processing latency.\\\\\\\\n- **&#96;clap_plugin_tail&#96;** (&#96;ext/tail.zig&#96;)  Report tail length (e.g., reverb decay).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAll extensions follow the pattern: plugin exposes an extension struct with function pointers, host queries via &#96;clap_plugin::get_extension&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Usage by Wrappers\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe CLAP wrapper (&#96;src/wrappers/clap/&#96;) uses these bindings to implement the CLAP ABI:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Export &#96;clap_entry&#96;** with &#96;init&#96;, &#96;deinit&#96;, &#96;get_factory&#96;.\\\\\\\\n2. **Implement &#96;clap_plugin_factory&#96;** to create plugin instances.\\\\\\\\n3. **Implement &#96;clap_plugin&#96;** with vtable functions that delegate to the framework core.\\\\\\\\n4. **Translate events** from &#96;clap_event_*&#96; to framework &#96;NoteEvent&#96;.\\\\\\\\n5. **Map audio buffers** from &#96;clap_audio_buffer_t&#96; to framework &#96;Buffer&#96; (zero-copy).\\\\\\\\n6. **Implement extensions** to expose parameters, state, ports, etc.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Zig 0.15.2 Compatibility\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThese bindings have been updated for Zig 0.15.2:\\\\\\\\n- All &#96;extern struct&#96; function pointer fields use explicit &#96;callconv(.c)&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- No &#96;usingnamespace&#96; (was removed from Zig).\\\\\\\\n- Explicit type annotations where required by 0.15.2 type inference changes.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Testing\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe bindings include basic tests verifying struct layouts and function pointer types. Run with:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;bash\\\\\\\\nzig build test\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCLAP bindings tests are part of the main test suite (43 tests from this module).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## See Also\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **[CLAP specification](https://github.com/free-audio/clap)**  Official CLAP headers and documentation\\\\\\\\n- **[Nakst CLAP tutorials](https://nakst.gitlab.io/tutorial/clap-part-1.html)**  Step-by-step C implementation\\\\\\\\n- **[docs/architecture.md](../../docs/architecture.md)**  How bindings fit into the overall architecture\\\\\\\\n- **Original bindings:** AGENTS.md  Coding Agent Guidelines for zig-plug\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Project Overview\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nzig-plug is an audio plugin framework for Zig 0.15.2 that lets a plugin author write one Zig module and produce both **VST3** and **CLAP** binaries from the same source. The architecture is inspired by **nih-plug** (Rust): an API-agnostic &#96;PluginInterface&#96; with thin format-specific wrappers that translate between the internal interface and the external ABI.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### License Compliance\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis project's framework code is licensed under the **Mozilla Public License 2.0** (MPL 2.0):\\\\\\\\n- License file: &#96;LICENSE&#96; (root directory)\\\\\\\\n- MPL 2.0 is file-based copyleft: modifications to framework files must be shared, but plugins built with the framework can be proprietary\\\\\\\\n- When creating new framework source files, include the MPL 2.0 header comment (see &#96;LICENSE&#96; Exhibit A)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe project also includes third-party bindings with their own licenses:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**CLAP bindings** (GNU LGPL v3.0):\\\\\\\\n- Location: &#96;src/bindings/clap/&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Original source: [clap-zig-bindings](https://git.sr.ht/~interpunct/clap-zig-bindings)\\\\\\\\n- Modified for: Zig 0.15.2 compatibility\\\\\\\\n- License file: &#96;src/bindings/clap/LICENSE&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**VST3 bindings** (MIT):\\\\\\\\n- Location: &#96;src/bindings/vst3/&#96;\\\\\\\\n- Based on: [Steinberg vst3_c_api](https://github.com/steinbergmedia/vst3_c_api)\\\\\\\\n- License file: &#96;src/bindings/vst3/LICENSE&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWhen distributing binaries or using this framework, comply with all applicable license requirements.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Core Design Principles\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThese are non-negotiable. Every change must respect them:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **API-agnostic plugin interface**  Plugin authors never touch VST3 or CLAP types directly. All plugin code goes through framework abstractions.\\\\\\\\n2. **Comptime-driven metadata**  Use Zig's &#96;comptime&#96; to generate vtables, parameter lists, GUIDs, and export symbols. No runtime reflection or code generation.\\\\\\\\n3. **No allocations on the audio thread**  The framework enforces real-time safety by design. &#96;process&#96; functions must never call allocators, acquire locks, or perform I/O.\\\\\\\\n4. **Minimal magic**  Prefer explicit over implicit. No hidden globals, no implicit initialization order.\\\\\\\\n5. **USE SIMD liberally where it makes sense**  This applies to abstractions and framework code, as well as making it convenient for plugin authors to use SIMD in their DSP code.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Architecture Layers\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\nPlugin Author Code    Framework Core    Format Wrappers    Low-Level Bindings\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Plugin Author Code**: Implements a struct with well-known declarations consumed by the framework at comptime.\\\\\\\\n- **Framework Core**: &#96;PluginInterface&#96;, &#96;Buffer&#96;, &#96;NoteEvent&#96;, &#96;ParamLayout&#96;, &#96;State&#96;, &#96;AudioIOLayout&#96;, &#96;ProcessContext&#96;.\\\\\\\\n- **Format Wrappers**: CLAP wrapper (C struct ABI, &#96;clap_entry&#96; export) and VST3 wrapper (COM vtable ABI, &#96;GetPluginFactory&#96; export).\\\\\\\\n- **Low-Level Bindings**: Idiomatic Zig bindings for CLAP C API and VST3 C API (&#96;vst3_c_api&#96;).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWhen adding code, place it in the correct layer. Never leak format-specific types upward into the core or plugin author
